title: >>> Killer INSTINCT
body_text:
The St. Valentine's Day Massacre of 1929? No Comparison.
Violent. Brutal. Merciless.
Just a few choice words to describe this collision of dodgeball giants. Two of the baddest warriors to ever compete go mano e mano in their epic return bout from the "St. Patrick's Day Massacre",
DODGEBALL 80
. And my oh my, how the tables have turned.
MEGILL vs. EDWARDS II
The then-undefeated sniper rifle Kevin Megill had to be as confident as ever. It was he who had butchered the elites of the game, establishing an awesome 3 and 0 record. With his upcoming showdown against inexperienced captain Mike Edwards, it looked as if DODGEBALL 80 would be a walk in the park. But those that witnessed the frigid March melee can surely remember the outcome, one that perhaps came as a surprise. "The Crazy One" Edwards had knocked off the powerhouse in Edward's tryout match, putting an end to Megill's seemingly interminable reign of terror. With the victory under his belt, the light and agile dodger set his sights on another equally athletic, and yes, unbeaten superstar, Mike "M Bizzle" Butler.
In the midst of the so-called
HeatWave '07
, "The Crazy One" turned it up a notch, stomping on Butler's precious record and throwing it away. Megill on the other hand had just bested the arrogant loud-mouth Diana DiBuccio at
DODGEBALL 85
, certainly taking one more giant step towards immortality. But there's never been a doubt that that one defeat on that freezing March night has haunted the iconic southpaw. At DODGEBALL 95, Megill will get this one chance to return the favor.
Exactly one year to the date of his debut, can Edwards retain the streak?
Or will the strategist Megill tie up this monumental clash at 1 apiece?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
body_html:
The St. Valentine's Day Massacre of 1929? No Comparison.

Violent. Brutal. Merciless. Just a few choice words to describe this collision of dodgeball giants. Two of the baddest warriors to ever compete go mano e mano in their epic return bout from the "St. Patrick's Day Massacre", DODGEBALL 80. And my oh my, how the tables have turned.

MEGILL vs. EDWARDS II
The then-undefeated sniper rifle Kevin Megill had to be as confident as ever. It was he who had butchered the elites of the game, establishing an awesome 3 and 0 record. With his upcoming showdown against inexperienced captain Mike Edwards, it looked as if DODGEBALL 80 would be a walk in the park. But those that witnessed the frigid March melee can surely remember the outcome, one that perhaps came as a surprise. "The Crazy One" Edwards had knocked off the powerhouse in Edward's tryout match, putting an end to Megill's seemingly interminable reign of terror. With the victory under his belt, the light and agile dodger set his sights on another equally athletic, and yes, unbeaten superstar, Mike "M Bizzle" Butler.

In the midst of the so-called HeatWave '07, "The Crazy One" turned it up a notch, stomping on Butler's precious record and throwing it away. Megill on the other hand had just bested the arrogant loud-mouth Diana DiBuccio at DODGEBALL 85, certainly taking one more giant step towards immortality. But there's never been a doubt that that one defeat on that freezing March night has haunted the iconic southpaw. At DODGEBALL 95, Megill will get this one chance to return the favor.

Exactly one year to the date of his debut, can Edwards retain the streak?
Or will the strategist Megill tie up this monumental clash at 1 apiece?
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
